version_description:
• sorting settings for deliveries
• faster barcode scanning
• faster map search
• 64-bit support
• account password length limit increased to 50 symbols
• improved China Post tracking

Please read important message in the end of this text.
Parcel was rewritten from the scratch to bring you the following features:
 
1. New gorgeous user interface for iPhone and iPad. Use swipe gestures to edit and delete shipments; pull down to refresh gesture. 
2. Deliveries filter. Now you can easily switch between active and delivered shipments. 
3. Significantly improved automatic carrier recognition.  Parcel remembers what couriers you use more often than the others. 
4. Accounts. Creating a free account in Parcel will let you to store your shipments safely and synchronize them across an unlimited number of devices. 
5. Extended version and Web Access were merged into Premium Subscription. Existing users of Extended version or Web Access get lifetime free Premium subscription.
6. Expected delivery date for USPS and Canada Post (if available). This feature is already available for FedEx and UPS.
7. New couriers: Poşta Română, Bulgarian Post, Lietuvos paštas, Slovenská pošta, South African Post Office, Magyar Posta, Chilexpress, General-Overnight, Avtotrading.

IMPORTANT. If you don't want to provide your email while creating a Parcel account, you may provide any fake email address you like. Please read why we decided to introduce accounts in Parcel 3.0:
http://parcelapp.net/why-accounts.html

Version 3.0.1:
- fixed bug with pasting URL into the tracking number field
- fixed bug with pasting passwords
- other bug fixes
- improved accessibility for VoiceOver users
- new couriers: Poste Italiane EMS, GLS Italy, PPL, Post NL (International), RATEK.

Two things to mention:
1) To delete a shipment, swipe with your finger to the right over it. This and other features are described in the FAQ.
2) If you don't want to provide your email while creating a Parcel account, you may provide any fake email address you like. Read why we decided to introduce accounts in Parcel 3.0: http://parcelapp.net/why-accounts.html
 
Version 3.0.0:
Parcel was rewritten from the scratch to bring you the following features: 

1. New gorgeous user interface for iPhone and iPad. Use swipe gestures to edit and delete shipments; pull down to refresh gesture. 
2. Deliveries filter. Now you can easily switch between active and delivered shipments. 
3. Significantly improved automatic carrier recognition. Parcel remembers what couriers you use more often than the others. 
4. Accounts. Creating a free account in Parcel will let you to store your shipments safely and synchronize them across an unlimited number of devices. 
5. Extended version and Web Access were merged into Premium Subscription. Existing users of Extended version or Web Access get lifetime free Premium subscription. 
6. Expected delivery date for USPS and Canada Post (if available). This feature was available before for FedEx and UPS only. 
7. New couriers: Poşta Română, Bulgarian Post, Lietuvos paštas, Slovenská pošta, South African Post Office, Magyar Posta, Chilexpress, General-Overnight, Avtotrading.

Parcel is now available for OS X! Download for free in the Mac App Store!
---
Version 3.0.2:
- bug fixes & minor UI improvements
- new couriers

Two things to mention: 
1) To delete a shipment, swipe with your finger to the right over it. This and other features are described in the FAQ. 
2) If you don't want to provide your email while creating a Parcel account, you may provide any fake email address you like. 
Read why we decided to introduce accounts in Parcel 3.0: http://parcelapp.net/why-accounts.html

Version 3.0.0: 
Parcel was rewritten from the scratch to bring you the following features: 
  1. New gorgeous user interface for iPhone and iPad. Use swipe gestures to edit and delete shipments; pull down to refresh gesture.  
2. Deliveries filter. Now you can easily switch between active and delivered shipments. 
 3. Significantly improved automatic carrier recognition. Parcel remembers what couriers you use more often than the others.  
4. Accounts. Creating a free account in Parcel will let you to store your shipments safely and synchronize them across an unlimited number of devices. 
 5. Extended version and Web Access were merged into Premium Subscription. Existing users of Extended version or Web Access get lifetime free Premium subscription.  
6. Expected delivery date for USPS and Canada Post (if available). This feature was available before for FedEx and UPS only.

1. This update brings day counter, which displays days till delivery or after postage. It can be enabled in the settings. 
2. Email notifications: this option enables sending copies of push notifications to your email. 
3. Swipe directions for delete/edit gestures have been changed to be more consistent with iOS 7. Swipe to the left to delete a delivery, swipe to right to edit.
4. Bug fixes, new couriers, small improvements.
---
Parcel is now available for OS X! Download for free in the Mac App Store!

• option to delete all completed deliveries (available in the settings when the total number of deliveries is more than 30)
• now you can add deliveries even when the courier's website is down
• fixed problem when barcode scanner was not performing well
• fixed problem when sorting by delivery date was incorrect
• many other bug fixes and improvements
• 7 new delivery companies

• Fixed bug when Apple ID dialog appeared on launch
• Fixed barcode scanner issues

Version 3.2.2:
• option to delete all completed deliveries (available in the settings when the total number of deliveries is more than 30) 
• now you can add deliveries even when the courier's website is down 
• fixed problem when barcode scanner was not performing well 
• fixed problem when sorting by delivery date was incorrect 
• many other bug fixes and improvements 
• 7 new delivery companies

• New sorting mode: sort your deliveries by name.
• Tapping on a push notification in the Notification Centre opens matching delivery in Parcel.
• Improved barcode scanning.
• Improved searching on map for Royal Mail and Parcelforce deliveries.
• Stability improvements.
• Support for 10 new delivery companies.

• Bug fixes and stability improvements. 

Version 3.3:
• New sorting mode: sort your deliveries by name. 
• Tapping on a push notification in the Notification Centre opens matching delivery in Parcel. 
• Improved barcode scanning. 
• Improved searching on map for Royal Mail and Parcelforce deliveries. 
• Stability improvements. 
• Support for 10 new delivery companies.

•  Updated icon and UI elements to better match iOS look and feel
•  Find on map feature updated to show full journey of your delivery
•  Today widget (requires iOS 8). Informs you if you have any deliveries arriving today or tomorrow (deliveries with expected delivery date only)
•  iOS 8 related fixes and improvements
•  Localization improvements
•  10 new couriers

- The app has received a slightly updated design to match the iOS 7 look and feel.
- New dynamic systemwide font support. In iOS 7, you can set your own system font size. Parcel will also show its tracking data according to these settings.
- Background push updates (iOS 7 only). Whenever a push message arrives from Parcel, it will automatically refresh data in the app in the background. As a result, by the time you launch the app after a push message, you will already have a new tracking data available.
- AirDrop sharing (iOS 7 only). Your can share a parcel to any other iOS-AirDrop compatible device.
- Pull to refresh is now available in the tracking history view.
- Fixed bug when the list of deliveries could be duplicated.

---
Parcel is now available for OS X! Download for free in the Mac App Store!

Improvements:
- iPhone landscape orientation support
- iPhone 6+ split screen mode support
- improved barcode scanning with tap to focus
- improved courier recognition for new users
- widget shows a warning before being automatically dismissed
- moderate UI improvements
- localization improvements

Fixes:
- fixed bug when AirDrop sharing was not available on iPad
- fixed crashing on barcode scanning
- fixed incorrect barcode scanning for USPS labels
- other bug fixes

Parcel was re-developed from scratch with a focus on new iOS 9 APIs, performance and UI improvements. 

New features:
• Adding new deliveries from other apps. Select a tracking number in Safari, Mail or any other app to bring the iOS contextual menu. Select "Share" and choose Parcel in the list of share extensions to quickly add a delivery. (Requires iOS 9 and activated share extension) 
• Search for your deliveries using Spotlight (iOS 9 only)
• When looking through delivery details in the app you can ask Siri to be reminded about that delivery (iOS 9 only)
• Support for iOS 9 multitasking on iPad
• Apple WatchOS 2 native app
• Today widget now provides you brief information about deliveries updated within the last two days if no expected deliveries are available
• Parcel Email: new service that allows you to automatically add new deliveries by forwarding your delivery emails to your unique email address. You can also use this service to track Amazon Logistics deliveries. Parcel Email can be set up in Web Access.
• Handoff support

Improvements:
• Redesigned day counter
• Redesigned new delivery view on iPhone
• App memory usage reduced by 20%
• Carrier recognition improvements
• Improvements for "Find on Map" feature
• Search is available in the app when looking though completed deliveries
• In case if the list of suggested carriers is long enough, search will be available for that list
• Other UI improvements

---
If you like the app, please leave a review to its latest version in the App Store. Your support means a huge difference to us!

• 3D Touch support. Shortcuts to add new delivery or open barcode scanner via the home screen icon. In the app you can use 3D Touch to view delivery on map directly from main list of deliveries (you can read more about why we decided to assign this particular feature for 3D Touch in the app FAQ).
• bug fixes and improvements

Parcel 4.0 was re-developed from scratch with a focus on new iOS 9 APIs, performance and UI improvements. 

New features:
• Adding new deliveries from other apps. Select a tracking number in Safari, Mail or any other app to bring the iOS contextual menu. Select "Share" and choose Parcel in the list of share extensions to quickly add a delivery. (Requires iOS 9 and activated share extension) 
• Search for your deliveries using Spotlight (iOS 9 only)
• When looking through delivery details in the app you can ask Siri to be reminded about that delivery (iOS 9 only)
• Support for iOS 9 multitasking on iPad
• Apple WatchOS 2 native app
• Today widget now provides you brief information about deliveries updated within the last two days if no expected deliveries are available
• Parcel Email: new service that allows you to automatically add new deliveries by forwarding your delivery emails to your unique email address. You can also use this service to track Amazon Logistics deliveries. Parcel Email can be set up in Web Access.
• Handoff support

Improvements:
• Redesigned day counter
• Redesigned new delivery view on iPhone
• App memory usage reduced by 20%
• Carrier recognition improvements
• Improvements for "Find on Map" feature
• Search is available in the app when looking though completed deliveries
• In case if the list of suggested carriers is long enough, search will be available for that list
• Other UI improvements

If you like the app, please leave a review to its latest version in the App Store. Your support means a huge difference to us!

• bug fixes and improvements related to iOS 9.2.

Parcel 4.0 was re-developed from scratch with a focus on new iOS 9 APIs, performance and UI improvements. 

New features:
• 3D Touch support. Shortcuts to add new delivery or open barcode scanner via the home screen icon. In the app you can use 3D Touch to view delivery on map directly from main list of deliveries (you can read more about why we decided to assign this particular feature for 3D Touch in the app FAQ).
• Adding new deliveries from other apps. Select a tracking number in Safari, Mail or any other app to bring the iOS contextual menu. Select "Share" and choose Parcel in the list of share extensions to quickly add a delivery. (Requires iOS 9 and activated share extension) 
• Search for your deliveries using Spotlight (iOS 9 only)
• When looking through delivery details in the app you can ask Siri to be reminded about that delivery (iOS 9 only)
• Support for iOS 9 multitasking on iPad
• Apple WatchOS 2 native app
• Today widget now provides you brief information about deliveries updated within the last two days if no expected deliveries are available
• Parcel Email: new service that allows you to automatically add new deliveries by forwarding your delivery emails to your unique email address. You can also use this service to track Amazon Logistics deliveries. Parcel Email can be set up in Web Access.
• Handoff support

Improvements:
• Redesigned day counter
• Redesigned new delivery view on iPhone
• App memory usage reduced by 20%
• Carrier recognition improvements
• Improvements for "Find on Map" feature
• Search is available in the app when looking though completed deliveries
• In case if the list of suggested carriers is long enough, search will be available for that list
• Other UI improvements

---
If you like the app, please leave a review to its latest version in the App Store. Your support means a huge difference to us!

After releasing a huge iOS 9 related update last fall the decision was made to focus on fixing bugs to make your tracking experience as smooth as possible.

Significant improvements were made to "Parcel Email" service, which has now processed more than 30,000 emails with tracking numbers.

Full list of changes:
• Parcel account email can be changed in the app settings
• Added general information about "Parcel Email" to the app settings (available to the premium subscribers only)
• Improved accuracy of locating UPS, Chronopost and TNT deliveries on the map
• General improvements to the carrier recognition system
• More than 30 new carriers added, total number of supported carriers is over 300
• Fixed a bug when sometimes expected delivery date would be displayed incorrectly
• Fixed a bug when using a custom keyboard with the share extension was not possible
• Fixed a bug when sometimes a keyboard would not be displayed for the share extension on iPad
• Fixed a UI bug associated with entering account credentials in the app settings
• Fixed a UI bug when a recently added delivery on iPad would have an incorrect separator displayed
• Fixed a UI bug when a dynamic push notification on Apple Watch would have an opaque background

We love updating Parcel with new features available in the latest iOS release every year. This year is not an exception!

• Find your delivery on map in notification details (iOS 10 required).
• See how far is your delivery from you in notification details (iOS 10 required). This option can be enabled in the app settings.
• New widget for today screen (iOS 10 required). The widget provides detailed information about your recent deliveries.
• Sometimes deliveries can have more than one carrier (international postgage is a good example of that). Parcel will suggest you to switch to destination carrier once it has tracking data. This feature is not yet available for all carriers with the full support to be available soon.
• Find on map feature is now far more accurate for those carriers who provide geographic coordinates for their deliveries.

Dozens of small improvements and bug fixes that you really should not waste time reading about :)

• indirect support for Amazon Logistics deliveries: tap and hold 'Track your package' link in shipping confirmation email from Amazon. Select 'Copy' from the menu and then start adding a new delivery in Parcel. Your Amazon order details will be recognized.
• new delivery icons for "Waiting for collection" and "Out for delivery" delivery events (including equivalent events for all 300 supported carriers)
• "Push on delivery only" mode now also includes events when a package is out for delivery and when it is ready for collection at post office. 
• support for iPhone 7 haptic feedback.
• improvements to the Apple Watch app: support for watchOS 3, background refresh, small modular, circular and utilitarian complications.
• carrier recognition improvements
• full support for PostNL International deliveries
• other improvements and bug fixes

• indirect support for Amazon Logistics deliveries: tap and hold 'Track your package' link in shipping confirmation email from Amazon. Select 'Copy' from the menu and then start adding a new delivery in Parcel. Your Amazon order details will be recognized.
• new delivery icons for "Waiting for collection" and "Out for delivery" delivery events (including equivalent events for all 300 supported carriers)
• "Push on delivery only" mode now also includes events when a package is out for delivery and when it is ready for collection at post office. 
• support for iPhone 7 haptic feedback.
• improvements to the Apple Watch app: support for watchOS 3, background refresh, small modular, circular and utilitarian complications.
• carrier recognition improvements
• full support for PostNL International deliveries
• other improvements and bug fixes
Parcel 5.0 has a new beautiful design that matches iOS 11 experience.
Bug fixes
iPhone X support and bug fixes

This update brings major improvements to push notifications:

Custom notification sounds
You can select from six different notification sounds in the app settings to be used for Parcel on all of your iOS and macOS devices.

Full support for app icon badges
Once you open the app, it will clear badges on all other devices (iOS and macOS). Notifications from Parcel will be cleared on all other devices as well (iOS only, macOS does not support that unfortunately).

Improved notifications for watchOS
Notifications on Apple Watch now have delivery title explicitly displayed.

Improved background refresh in watchOS
If you have Parcel in your Dock or on your watch face, it will update its data in background far more reliably.

• the main widget now updates on its own, without relying on background refreshes made by the app. You will see a spinning activity indicator when that happens. This feature is available on iOS 11 only.
• when using estimated delivery date as a sorting mode, packages that are out for delivery or awaiting collection are now listed in the top of the list even if they don't have an estimated delivery date. They still will be listed below any deliveries with a delivery date. This change will apply only to new deliveries added with this update.
• barcode scanner now works faster (thanks to the new iOS 11 Vision framework)
• improvements related to Handoff support
• the watch app now displays only first 20 deliveries, this limitation allows better performance of the app
• UI bug fixes related to iPhone X support

Bug fixes and small improvements. 
Version 5.2 had a number of new features:
• the main widget now updates on its own, without relying on background refreshes made by the app. You will see a spinning activity indicator when that happens. This feature is available on iOS 11 only.
• when using estimated delivery date as a sorting mode, packages that are out for delivery or awaiting collection are now listed in the top of the list even if they don't have an estimated delivery date. They still will be listed below any deliveries with a delivery date. This change will apply only to new deliveries added with this update.
• barcode scanner now works faster (thanks to the new iOS 11 Vision framework)
• improvements related to Handoff support
• the watch app now displays only first 20 deliveries, this limitation allows better performance of the app
• UI bug fixes related to iPhone X support
bug fixes
Bug fixes and small improvements

• when you receive many push notifications from Parcel, they are grouped by delivery in the notification center (iOS 12 required)
• if you received a notification that a delivery was completed, you can delete this delivery right from the notification
• expected delivery time windows are now supported, e.g. from 2pm to 5pm (when available from a carrier)
• improved support for iCloud keychain, now when you register or sign in to your Parcel account, the app will save your password to iCloud keychain (iOS 12 required)
• improvements related to "Find on Map" feature

• added support for Siri Shortcuts. The following two shortcuts are available: adding a new delivery and scanning a barcode. Shortcuts can be configured in the system settings (Siri & Search section).
• added support for new complications for the following Apple Watch faces: Infograph, Infograph Modular, Modular. Infograph watch face can be configured to display estimated date of arrival for one of your deliveries in the corner. Modular watch face can be configured to display delivery status and estimated date of arrival.
• added support for Siri watch face for Apple Watch. Siri might decide to display information about your upcoming delivery on that watch face.
Bug fixes
Minor improvements and bug fixes
Bug fixes
Added support for Siri Watch Face on Apple Watch. Now you should be able to see there deliveries that are expected today.

• if you sort your deliveries by estimated date of arrival, deliveries that are out for delivery or expecting collection will now be always on top
• if there is a new estimated delivery date available from a carrier, you will get a separate notification about that
• added option to delete Parcel account in the app settings
• bug fixes and improvements
Minor bug fixes related to the watch app

• added support for the new iPad Pro
• added keyboard shortcuts that can be used with external iPad keyboards
• bug fixes
Minor improvements and bug fixes
bug fixes
bug fixes
Bug fixes

• if you sort your deliveries by estimated date of arrival, deliveries that are out for delivery or expecting collection will now be always on top
• if there is a new estimated delivery date available from a carrier, you will get a separate notification about that
• added option to delete Parcel account in the app settings
• bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes
Added support for Siri Watch Face on Apple Watch. Now you should be able to see there deliveries that are expected today.
Minor bug fixes and improvements

Updated phone numbers for the top 100 carriers in the app. As a reminder, you can use "Contact Customer Service" option in the app to get in touch with your carrier. The app will suggest a phone number to call.
Small bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes

New Barcode Scanner Powered by Machine Learning (iOS 13)
Thanks to the latest advancements in machine learning available in iOS 13, Parcel now offers a new barcode scanner that does more than just getting a tracking number from a barcode. It also tries to recognize a carrier based on a package label that you scan. 

Support for “Sign in with Apple” (iOS 13)
Sign in with Apple is a great way to create new accounts in 3rd party apps while keeping your personal information private. Not only you can create new accounts in Parcel using “Sign in with Apple”, you can also convert your existing Parcel account if you want to. Parcel does not ask for name, email or password when using “Sign in with Apple”.

Siri Shortcuts
Parcel now has a new Siri shortcut that allows you to see the latest information about your active deliveries. It is very simple to use and you can set it up in the app settings.

Dark Mode (iOS 13)
Not much to say, Parcel supports dark mode in iOS 13 and it looks great.

Support for Contextual Actions (iOS 13)
Now you can tap and hold on a delivery to perform actions on it. You can either track on website, find on map or mark as completed right from the deliveries list. This allows you to save time because normally to access those actions you would need to open a delivery first and then tap on the actions button.

Improvements:
• when you search for a delivery in Spotlight, you can tap and hold on it to see its full history
• delivery status icons in the main list are adjusted in size according to your system font size (iOS 13)
• when there is a suggestion from the app to change delivery carrier, you will see a new icon for that

• new delivery filter mode: "Recent Deliveries". When this filter mode is enabled, you will see only active deliveries and deliveries that were completed in the last 24 hours
• new complication for Infograph Modular watch face
• improved accessibility support for Voice Control in iOS 13
• fixed bug when search field might be corrupted in the carrier selection list
• fixed bug when barcode scanner was not working correctly on iPad

• New couriers: UPS MI, Fastway Australia, Fastway New Zealand, TNT Italy, In-time, JDE, PEK
• Exporting shipments to Excel via Web Access (web.parcelapp.net)
• Bug Fixes

• visual improvements to the share extension
• small improvements related to sharing deliveries
• improvements related to the watch app first launch
• fixed bug when Infograph Modular Apple Watch complication was not updating

• when a delivery is expected today, day counter will show "0" (when it is set to "Days Till Delivery" mode)
• when there is a problem with a delivery (e.g. delayed, damaged, requires attention), there will be an exclamation mark displayed next to it as an icon
• when "Delivery Push Only" mode is enabled, you will also get notifications when a delivery attempt was made or if there is a problem
Small improvements and bug fixes

Improved Date Formatting

Parcel will now try to format delivery event dates to match your system regional settings and your current time zone. For example, you will be able to see something like "Today 8 am" instead of "21 Feb 2020 8 am" when looking at a delivery event.

This feature is not available for all carriers and it will never be (not all of them provide time zone information). This feature will apply to only new deliveries.
This update brings improved pointer support on the iPad. Also, shorter launch time of the app.
This update brings improved pointer support on the iPad. Also, shorter launch time of the app.

• added Japanese localization
• misc improvements and bug fixes
Small improvements
Improvements related to carrier detection and small UI bug fixes.

• fixed bug when the "Manage Subscription" button was not working
• improved carrier detection for DHL Global Mail

When at looking at the map you will notice that lines between cities where your package has traveled follow the contours of the Earth (they appear curved over long distances). Also, improvements to trackpad and keyboard support on iPad.
Fixed bug when sometimes the new curved map lines were displayed incorrectly.

Delivery Descriptions for Amazon Packages Added Using Parcel Email

If you are using our Parcel Email service to get Amazon deliveries added automatically to the app, you have probably noticed that they no longer have proper descriptions like they used to.

This is because Amazon no longer provides order descriptions in its emails.

With this update, if you select a delivery from Amazon that was added using Parcel Email (with an order number in its name), you will see the option to sign in to Amazon. If you sign in, all future deliveries like that will be renamed automatically on your device.

Please note that your credentials are not saved in the app and are not sent anywhere else. It is a safe feature from a security point of view.

If you have not previously used Parcel Email, here is more information about it:
https://parcelapp.net/parcel-email.html
Bug fixes

New widget for iOS 14:
• pick from three available sizes
• pin a specific delivery to the top in the widget settings
• if the widget is in a smart stack, it should appear more frequently when a delivery is expected today

App Clips:
• when you share a delivery using iMessage, the app generates a special link
• if the other person taps on that link in iOS 14 and he does not have Parcel installed, either Parcel App Clip will be launched or he will be redirected to Safari where the app clip can be launched
• if the same link is opened on a different device, a web page with delivery details is loaded

Account Extension for iOS 14:
If you have a Parcel account password saved in your iCloud keychain, you might get a suggestion from iOS to update your password if it is considered to be insecure. Should you accept this suggestion, your password will be updated immediately without launching the app.

Other improvements:
• updated menus for delivery options and filter settings to match iOS 14 style
• if you are using the day counter in the “days after postage” mode, you will notice a new date picker when manually setting the postage date

• when you share a delivery using iMessage, the recipient can track this delivery using Parcel app clip right from the Messages app, without launching Safari (if she/he does not have Parcel installed, iOS 14 is required)

What's new in version 6.5:

New widget for iOS 14:
• pick from three available sizes
• pin a specific delivery to the top in the widget settings
• if the widget is in a smart stack, it should appear more frequently when a delivery is expected today

App Clips:
• when you share a delivery using iMessage, the app generates a special link
• if the other person taps on that link in iOS 14 and he does not have Parcel installed, Parcel App Clip will be launched
• if the same link is opened on a different device, a web page with delivery details is loaded

Account Extension for iOS 14:
If you have a Parcel account password saved in your iCloud keychain, you might get a suggestion from iOS to update your password if it is considered to be insecure. Should you accept this suggestion, your password will be updated immediately without launching the app.

Other improvements:
• updated menus for delivery options and filter settings to match iOS 14 style
• if you are using the day counter in the “days after postage” mode, you will notice a new date picker when manually setting the postage date
Improvements related to Amazon Logistics support
Fixed bug when Amazon deliveries were incorrectly renamed by the app

Amazon Integration (iOS 14 required)

You can now sign in to your Amazon account in the app settings. Once you sign in, your active packages will be imported automatically. You will not need to add them manually.

Amazon Integration (iOS 14 required)

You can now sign in to your Amazon account in the app settings. Once you sign in, your active packages will be imported automatically. You will not need to add them manually.

Amazon Integration (iOS 14 required)

You can now sign in to your Amazon account in the app settings. Once you sign in, your active packages will be imported automatically. You will not need to add them manually.

This update brings a new setting for Amazon integration. Now you can instruct the app to automatically switch to a final mile carrier when a package is not being delivered by Amazon itself.

Amazon Integration (iOS 14 required)

You can now sign in to your Amazon account in the app settings. Once you sign in, your active packages will be imported automatically. You will not need to add them manually.

This update brings small bug fixes related to Amazon integration.
Improvements related to Amazon integration
Improvements related to Amazon integration

Live Text Support for Scanning Tracking Numbers (iOS 15 required)
Now you can use the Live Text feature in iOS 15 to quickly scan a tracking number using a camera from a package label or a screen. This is useful when you don’t have a barcode to scan and you don’t want to type a number yourself. To use this feature, tap on the camera icon when adding a delivery. Please note that you need a device with the A12 chip or later to use that feature.

Support for Time-Sensitive Notifications (iOS 15 required)
Time-sensitive notifications can optionally break through even when there is a focus mode enabled in iOS 15. Parcel sends time-sensitive notifications when a package is out for delivery, available for collection, or has a delivery exception. It also sends a time-sensitive notification when a package is delivered, unless there is a clear indication in the final delivery status that it was delivered with a signature or into the mailbox.

Added Support for Quick Notes (iPadOS 15 required)
Now you can quickly create a new quick note on your iPad when checking your delivery status. Once you start creating a new quick note, you will be able to attach a link to your current delivery.

Extra Large Map Widget on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Added a map widget in the new extra-large size on iPad.

Improved Keyboard Shortcuts on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Keyboard shortcuts related to the delivery filter settings are now grouped into a separate menu when previewing shortcuts (hold Command button to do that in iPadOS).

Improvements related to Amazon integration. Our previous update had a number of new features for iOS 15:

Live Text Support for Scanning Tracking Numbers (iOS 15 required)
Now you can use the Live Text feature in iOS 15 to quickly scan a tracking number using a camera from a package label or a screen. This is useful when you don’t have a barcode to scan and you don’t want to type a number yourself. To use this feature, tap on the camera icon when adding a delivery. Please note that you need a device with the A12 chip or later to use that feature.

Support for Time-Sensitive Notifications (iOS 15 required)
Time-sensitive notifications can optionally break through even when there is a focus mode enabled in iOS 15. Parcel sends time-sensitive notifications when a package is out for delivery, available for collection, or has a delivery exception. It also sends a time-sensitive notification when a package is delivered, unless there is a clear indication in the final delivery status that it was delivered with a signature or into the mailbox.

Added Support for Quick Notes (iPadOS 15 required)
Now you can quickly create a new quick note on your iPad when checking your delivery status. Once you start creating a new quick note, you will be able to attach a link to your current delivery.

Extra Large Map Widget on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Added a map widget in the new extra-large size on iPad.

Improved Keyboard Shortcuts on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Keyboard shortcuts related to the delivery filter settings are now grouped into a separate menu when previewing shortcuts (hold Command button to do that in iPadOS).

Improvements related to Amazon integration. Our previous update had a number of new features for iOS 15:

Live Text Support for Scanning Tracking Numbers (iOS 15 required)
Now you can use the Live Text feature in iOS 15 to quickly scan a tracking number using a camera from a package label or a screen. This is useful when you don’t have a barcode to scan and you don’t want to type a number yourself. To use this feature, tap on the camera icon when adding a delivery. Please note that you need a device with the A12 chip or later to use that feature.

Support for Time-Sensitive Notifications (iOS 15 required)
Time-sensitive notifications can optionally break through even when there is a focus mode enabled in iOS 15. Parcel sends time-sensitive notifications when a package is out for delivery, available for collection, or has a delivery exception. It also sends a time-sensitive notification when a package is delivered, unless there is a clear indication in the final delivery status that it was delivered with a signature or into the mailbox.

Added Support for Quick Notes (iPadOS 15 required)
Now you can quickly create a new quick note on your iPad when checking your delivery status. Once you start creating a new quick note, you will be able to attach a link to your current delivery.

Extra Large Map Widget on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Added a map widget in the new extra-large size on iPad.

Improved Keyboard Shortcuts on iPad (iPadOS 15 required)
Keyboard shortcuts related to the delivery filter settings are now grouped into a separate menu when previewing shortcuts (hold Command button to do that in iPadOS).

Now you can delete multiple deliveries at once. To do that, tap and hold on any delivery and select the relevant menu option to enable multiple selection. After that select the deliveries you don’t need and tap on “Delete”.

Other improvements:
• map position is restored in a thumbnail after leaving the map view
• improved messaging for cases when the app server is not available
• improved messaging for adding PostNL deliveries
This update improves handling of daylight savings time for notifications sent to you when the option “Notifications At Night” is disabled.
This update improves Amazon integration in the app.

This update brings new map pins to the map view in the app and to the map widget. New pins have a fresh look and indicate what kind of an event took place on the map.

I hope that you will like them!

Please note that only new deliveries will get additional map pin icons (for the events like “out for delivery” and “awaiting collection”). Old deliveries that you had before installing this update will mostly show only truck icons (indicating that an item is in transit).
